From: David Herron <davidh@...>


"Java Test" is the harness that drives the TCK (JCK) tests. Any licensee
who has validated their Java implementation should be able to tell you
about it.

I believe it was never released publicly outside of the TCK tests.

It is a harness for running tests.

The product that Sun scrapped was called Java Star.  It did GUI automation
testing by plopping stuff into the event queue, and also some kind of
capture/record/playback was involved.  However, since it does it through
the event queue, I found it entirely useless to my needs and Robot does
the specific automation things that I need (ya have to build stuff around
Robot though, but so what).


- David



On Tue, 14 Aug 2001, Mike Clark wrote:

> Richard Jensen wrote:
>
> > I'm trying to get a team to use JUnit to do automated unit testing.
> > One of our members referenced 'JavaTest' from Sun and gave me a .pdf
> > document (~180 pages) with a description of it. I went to
> > java.sun.com to see if I could find anything else about it but came
> > up empty.
> >
> > Has anyone compared JUnit with JavaTest?
> >
>
> Hmmm.... I thought Sun scrapped that product a while back, but I could be
> wrong.
>
> Mike
